channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Why are 'fireworks' coming from a black hole? This is what scientists say
item.description: A team of astrophysicists have found flares of light in Sagittarius A*, a supermassive black hole in the center of the Milky Way.
item.content:encoded:
'/>

A team of astrophysicists have found flares of light in Sagittarius A*, a supermassive black hole in the center of the Milky Way.

(Image credit: NASA, ESA, CSA, Ralf Crawford (STScI))
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: First CDC vaccine meeting under Trump administration is postponed
item.description: The panel of vaccine experts were supposed to hold their first meeting under the Trump administration in late February. It's not clear when that meeting will now take place.
item.content:encoded:
The panel of vaccine experts were supposed to hold their first meeting under the Trump administration in late February. It's not clear when that meeting will now take place.

(Image credit: Jeff Amy)
item.dc:creator: Will Stone

item.title: Venezuelan mothers organize on chat group to fight Guantánamo detentions
item.description: The mothers met in a Whatsapp group. They have vowed to fight until their sons, who they say have not committed crimes and do not have ties to gangs, are released.
item.content:encoded:
The mothers met in a Whatsapp group. They have vowed to fight until their sons, who they say have not committed crimes and do not have ties to gangs, are released.

(Image credit: Via the Sequera, Roldán, and Arapé families)
item.dc:creator: Sergio Martínez-Beltrán

item.title: Reversing U.S. policy, Trump attacks Zelenskyy, blames Ukraine for war with Russia
item.description: The U.S. has been the strongest supporter of Ukraine in its war with Russia. Yet with a series of blunt comments, President Trump now sounds more aligned with Russia than Ukraine.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. has been the strongest supporter of Ukraine in its war with Russia. Yet with a series of blunt comments, President Trump now sounds more aligned with Russia than Ukraine.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb)
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre

item.title: Greenlandic politician describes struggle to remember 'America has good people'
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with Greenlandic parliamentary candidate Naaja Nathanielsen about the continued Trump administration push to acquire the territory.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with Greenlandic parliamentary candidate Naaja Nathanielsen about the continued Trump administration push to acquire the territory.
item.dc:creator: Matt Ozug

item.title: Exclusive: Trump administration drops work on stronger building codes for disasters
item.description: To help homes survive more intense disasters, FEMA has been developing recommendations for stronger building codes. The Trump Administration has pulled them back.
item.content:encoded:
To help homes survive more intense disasters, FEMA has been developing recommendations for stronger building codes. The Trump Administration has pulled them back.

(Image credit: Miguel J. Rodriguez Carrillo/AFP)
item.dc:creator: Lauren Sommer

item.title: How Will the New Syria Be Governed?
item.description: After 14 years of a devastating civil war, Syria is in the process of reinventing itself. One big question is how the country will be governed now that the more than 50 years of rule by the Assad family has come to an end. For clues on what the future might hold, our correspondent goes to the city that was run by a rebel group during the war. That group led the toppling of the Assad regime and now controls the interim government.
item.content:encoded: After 14 years of a devastating civil war, Syria is in the process of reinventing itself. One big question is how the country will be governed now that the more than 50 years of rule by the Assad family has come to an end. For clues on what the future might hold, our correspondent goes to the city that was run by a rebel group during the war. That group led the toppling of the Assad regime and now controls the interim government.
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: These far-right media figures are getting center stage under Trump
item.description: The Trump administration has welcomed far-right media figures in the White House briefing room and elsewhere, even as it restricts access for established news outlets.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration has welcomed far-right media figures in the White House briefing room and elsewhere, even as it restricts access for established news outlets.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb/AFP)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: NY Governor won't remove NYC Mayor Adams from office, another win for President Trump
item.description: NYC Mayor Eric Adams emerged as a key ally of President Trump on his immigration crackdown after Trump's DOJ agreed to shelve corruption charges. Governor Hochul says Adams will remain in office.
item.content:encoded:
NYC Mayor Eric Adams emerged as a key ally of President Trump on his immigration crackdown after Trump's DOJ agreed to shelve corruption charges. Governor Hochul says Adams will remain in office.

(Image credit: Elsa)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Senate confirms Kash Patel, fierce critic of FBI, to head the bureau
item.description: Republicans welcomed Kash Patel's confirmation, seeing him as someone who can fix the FBI's alleged targeting of conservatives in recent years.
item.content:encoded:
Republicans welcomed Kash Patel's confirmation, seeing him as someone who can fix the FBI's alleged targeting of conservatives in recent years.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas
